alert.note: Alert for Central and South Weld County; Larimer County Below 6000 Feet, Northwest Weld County; Northeast Weld County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 28 at 5:21PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Weld County through 600 PM MDT... At 520 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles northwest of Briggsdale, or 26 miles northeast of Greeley, moving southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Briggsdale. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: Prepare for sudden gusty winds. Secure loose objects and move to a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Central and South Weld County; Larimer County Below 6000 Feet, Northwest Weld County; Northeast Weld County
